column1: #Text=Nipigon is a township of 1,600 people ( 2011 ) on the north shore of Lake Superior in Northern Ontario .

#Text=Nipigon is a small village on an isolated section of Trans-Canada Highway which follows the sparsely-populated north shore of Lake Superior between Thunder Bay and Sault Sainte Marie ( Ontario ) .
#Text=There is little population and few services outside the few villages on this lengthy stretch of highway .
#Text=The local economy of Nipigon Township depends primarily on forest products , fishing , and tourism .
#Text=Multiply Forest Products , a hundred-worker sawmill which was the largest employer in Nipigon , burned to the ground on February 6 , 2007 .
#Text=Nipigon 's population declined by over 25 % between 1991 and 2011 .
#Text=Nipigon is a departure point for fishing excursions onto Lake Superior , the Nipigon River system and Lake Nipigon .
#Text=Common fish varieties include Atlantic salmon , lake trout , speckled trout , rainbow trout , walleye , northern pike , bass , and perch .
#Text=In Jan 2016 , the Nipigon River Bridge , the first cable-stayed bridge in Ontario , failed weeks after it opened .
#Text=Traffic was rerouted through the United States , and road transportation between eastern and western Canada was not possible for a period of 17 hours .
#Text=A pair of two-lane cable-stayed bridges opened in Nov 2018 .
#Text=Late May to mid-Oct : M – F 8:30AM – 4:30PM , in the summer open M - F until 8PM and Sa Su 10AM-8PM .
#Text=Interactive historical displays about the area , clean washrooms .
#Text=Nipigon is on the Trans-Canada Highway where Ontario Highways 11 and 17 run concurrently .
#Text=This means that there is only one road connecting eastern and western Canada .
#Text=The stretch between Nipigon and Thunder Bay is designated the Terry Fox Courage Highway .
#Text=There is no passenger rail service in Nipigon-Thunder Bay .
#Text=Kasper Bus bus service connects to White River and Thunder Bay .

#Text=History of Nipigon from the fur trade to development of the forest industry , displayed through literature and artefacts : tools that were used , products that were made , pictures of people there at that time .
#Text=8-km ( 5-mi ) all-season riverside trail connecting the Nipigon and Red Rock Marinas .
#Text=Several lookout points ( the most dramatic of which is Eagle 's Ridge ) ; leaves and foliage take on their fall colours from mid August through October .
#Text=Northshore Golf and Country Club , Golf Course Rd ( off Trans-Canada 11/17 between Nipigon and Red Rock ) , ☏ +1807 887-2006 .
#Text=Nine-hole golf course with licensed dining room and restaurant , open 7 days a week .
#Text=Paddle to the Sea Park , 52 Front Street ( beside the shops and restaurants ) .
#Text=A water park and interactive playground based on the book Paddle to the Sea , which was made into a film by the National Film Board of Canada .
#Text=Bowman Island Lodge and Charters , RR#1 Nipigon , ☏ +1807 886-2504 .
#Text=Bowman Island is off the south shore of St Ignace Island in the Lake Superior Marine Conservation Area .
#Text=A 30-ft water taxi and 45-ft trawler carry 8-10 passengers .
#Text=Outfitter supplies fishing packages ( fly rod , spin cast or troll ) , transportation for canoes or kayaks , outdoor adventure packages .
#Text=By the Bay Adventures , Nipigon Marina , 3 Brennen Drive , ☏ +1807 887-4614 .
#Text=McGuire Farm and Greenhouse , 600 Hwy 17 ( RR#1 ) , ☏ +1807 886-1151 , fax : +1807 886-9909 .
#Text=Eco guiding tours and moose hunt guide , fresh blueberries and vegetables in season .
#Text=Fishing and hunting packages , day excursions , dinner cruises , kayaking and sightseeing .
#Text=Nipigon River Bear Hunts , Hwy 17 , ☏ +1807 887-2813 , toll-free : +1-877-825-7417 , fax : +1807 887-3801 .
#Text=Local guide Bob Bearman leads ( typically ) six-day all-inclusive hunting expeditions for bear , wolf and moose . US$ 2000 - 5000 .

#Text=Guided berry picking , local craft and food sales , live music , Active Circus Zone , juggling show , youth talent show , active-play children ’s games , minnow races , crafts for kids , cards for seniors , face-painting and Teddy Bear ’s Picnic .
#Text=Ouimet Canyon Provincial Park , Eagle Canyon Adventures and the Dorion Fish Culture Station are on Trans-Canada 11/17 west of Nipigon/Red Rock .
#Text=Winter camping and ice climbing , Beginners , Intermediate and Advanced/Mixed levels .

#Text=A limited selection is available in the village , including a grocer ( Zechner 's ) , hardware ( Home Hardware and Canadian Tire ) , auto towing and repair ; there is a discount store ( the Bargain Shop ) and a second-hand store for clothing and general merchandise .
#Text=Freshly baked goods , homemade soups & sandwiches , pizza .
#Text=Across the street from Paddle to the Sea Park . Breakfasts $ 6 - 9 ; individual pizzas , sandwiches and wraps $ 10 .
#Text=Home cooked meals , and Pub foods , patio and licensed dining room .
#Text=Beer and spirits are available for takeaway from the Beer Store and the LCBO .
#Text=Single/double rooms and 2-bed/1-bath apartment-house suites with LCD TVs , full kitchenette in some rooms .
#Text=Wi-Fi , 32 " flat screen TV with movie channels , fridges , microwaves , phones , coffee , bottled water and ice .
